member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner
member.summary: Drag Adorner - this was taken from a sample posted by Bea Stollnitz See http://www.beacosta.com/blog/?p=53 for the original article.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.#ctor(System.Object,System.Windows.DataTemplate,System.Windows.UIElement,System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer)
member.summary: Constructor for the drag adorner

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.SetPosition(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This changes the position of the adorner.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Implements any custom measuring behavior for the adorner.
member.returns: A object representing the amount of layout space needed by the adorner.
member.param: A size to constrain the adorner to.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, positions child elements and determines a size for a derived class.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.GetVisualChild(System.Int32)
member.summary: Overrides , and returns a child at the specified index from a collection of child elements.
member.returns: The requested child element. This should not return null; if the provided index is out of range, an exception is thrown.
member.param: The zero-based index of the requested child element in the collection.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.GetDesiredTransform(System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransform)
member.summary: Returns a for the adorner, based on the transform that is currently applied to the adorned element.
member.returns: A transform to apply to the adorner.
member.param: The transform that is currently applied to the adorned element.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.Dispose
member.summary: This removes the item from the adorner layer

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragAdorner.VisualChildrenCount
member.summary: Gets the number of visual child elements within this element.
member.returns: The number of visual child elements for this element.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ChangeThemeAction
member.summary: This changes the window's theme to the given theme URI.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ChangeThemeAction.ThemeUriProperty
member.summary: Theme URI to apply to the application

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ChangeThemeAction.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes the action.
member.param: The parameter to the action. If the Action does not require a parameter, the parameter may be set to a null reference.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ChangeThemeAction.RaiseThemeChanged
member.summary: Raises the ThemeChanged event

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ChangeThemeAction.ThemeUri
member.summary: Theme URI to apply to the application.

member.name: E:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ChangeThemeAction.ThemeChanged
member.summary: This event is raised when the theme is changed.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior
member.summary: This behavior associates a watermark onto a TextBox indicating what the user should provide as input.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.TextProperty
member.summary: The watermark text

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.IsWatermarkedPropertyKey
member.summary: Readonly property used to style the TextBox when the watermark is present

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.IsWatermarkedProperty
member.summary: This readonly property is applied to the TextBox and indicates whether the watermark is currently being displayed. It allows a style to change the visual appearanve of the TextBox.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.GetIsWatermarked(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox)
member.summary: Retrieves the current watermarked state of the TextBox.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the behavior is attached to an AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: Override this to hook up functionality to the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.OnTextChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.TextChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when the text for the TextBox is changed.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the behavior is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.
member.remarks: Override this to unhook functionality from the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.OnGotFocus(System.Object,System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when the textbox gains focus. It removes the watermark.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.OnLostFocus(System.Object,System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when focus is lost from the TextBox. It puts the watermark into place if no text is in the textbox.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.ChangeText(System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to change the text.
member.param: New string to assign to TextBox

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.IsWatermarked
member.summary: Retrieves the current watermarked state of the TextBox.

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.WatermarkTextBoxBehavior.Text
member.summary: The watermark text

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior
member.summary: ItemsControlDragDropBehavior can be used to add automatic Drag/Drop support to any ItemsControl based element.
member.remarks: This was originally taken from a sample posted by Bea Stollnitz See http://www.beacosta.com/blog/?p=53 for the original article. I have also borrowed elements from http://code.google.com/p/gong-wpf-dragdrop/ which was an extension of the above codebase.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the behavior is attached to an AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: Override this to hook up functionality to the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Starts the drag/drop operation.

member.summary: Display the drag indicator

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.PreviewMouseLeftButtonUp(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Stops the drag/drop operation

member.summary: New drop target identified

member.summary: New drop target being dragged over

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.DragLeave(System.Object,System.Windows.DragEventArgs)
member.summary: Drop target has left control airspace

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.PreviewQueryContinueDrag(System.Object,System.Windows.QueryContinueDragEventArgs)
member.summary: Query to continue dragging operation

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.PreviewDrop(System.Object,System.Windows.DragEventArgs)
member.summary: Drop started

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.DragStarted(System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: This starts the drag operation from the given ItemsControl

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.GetDropEffectType(System.Windows.DragDropEffects,System.Windows.DragDropKeyStates)
member.summary: Returns the drop effects allowed

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.HandleDragScrolling(System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl,System.Windows.DragEventArgs)
member.summary: This scrolls the items control when we hit a boundary

member.summary: Determine the proper insertion index

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.ResetState
member.summary: Resets the drag/drop operation

member.summary: Initialize the drag adorner -- this is the DataTemplate instantiation of the item

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.UpdateDragAdorner(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Update the position of the drag adorner

member.summary: Initialize the insertion point marker

member.summary: Update the position of the insertion point marker

member.summary: Remove all the adorners

member.summary: Key used for drag/drop operations

member.summary: Data template to represent drag items

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.AllowOnlySelf
member.summary: True to only allow "Self" as drop target

member.summary: This event is raised when a drag/drop operation starts

member.summary: This event is raised when a target is identified

member.name: E:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.ItemsControlDragDropBehavior.DropInitiated
member.summary: This event is raised when a drop is initiated

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior
member.summary: This behavior changes the Text for the associated TextBlock to the current row index of the DataGridRow it is bound to.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.TargetProperty
member.summary: Internal target property used to track current item of DataGridRow.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.DataGridRowProperty
member.summary: DataGridRow this behavior uses to determine the proper row index.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.OnDataGridRowChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called when the DataGridRow property is changed. It generally means a new row has been added into the grid and we need to set the initial row value for it. We won't see a CollectionChange for this item - the event isn't hooked up yet.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.OnDetachFromDataGridRow(System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow)
member.summary: Detaches object from row - called when being unloaded.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.OnItemPropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called when the item associated with the DG row changes; this possibly requires a change in the index.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.DgRowEditEnding(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRowEditEndingEventArgs)
member.summary: This is used to reset the header on the NewItemPlaceholder.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.CvCollectionChanged(System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called when the ItemsSource collection changes - i.e. it is sorted, items are removed, inserted, etc. It updates the *existing* row numbers.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the behavior is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DataGridRowIndexBehavior.DataGridRow
member.summary: DataGridRow this behavior uses to determine the proper row index.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Internal.DragInfo
member.summary: This class is passed around from drop source to target

member.summary: Called when the behavior is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.
member.remarks: Override this to unhook functionality from the AssociatedObject.

member.summary: Collection to synchronize

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior
member.summary: WPF attached behavior which attaches the NumericTextBoxBehavior to any TextBox.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.MIN_DELTA
member.summary: Minimum amount of distance mouse must be "dragged" before we begin changing the numeric value.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.IsEnabledProperty
member.summary: This property allows the behavior to be used as a traditional attached property behavior.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.GetIsEnabled(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox)
member.summary: Returns whether NumericTextBoxBehavior is enabled via attached property

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.SetIsEnabled(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds NumericTextBoxBehavior to TextBox

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.AllowMouseDragProperty
member.summary: AllowMouseDrag Dependency Property

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: This attaches the property handlers - PreviewKeyDown, Clipboard support and our adorner.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.AddAdorner(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox)
member.summary: This adds the adorner.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: This removes all our handlers.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.OnClipboardPaste(System.Object,System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs)
member.summary: This method handles paste and drag/drop events onto the TextBox. It restricts the character set to numerics and ensures we have consistent behavior.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.OnKeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: This checks the PreviewKeyDown on the TextBox and constrains it to a numeric value.

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.AllowMouseDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets the AllowMouseDrag property. When set to "True", the NumericTextBoxBehavior will allow Mouse "drags" to adjust the value - similar to the Blend text boxes.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner
member.summary: This visual adorner is used to provide mouse cursor + numeric up/down drag support on top of an existing TextBox. It provides scroll wheel + left/right dragging

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.#ctor(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.OnQueryCursor(System.Windows.Input.QueryCursorEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called as the cursor moves to change the visual representation on the screen. We display the W/E cursor or the IBeam.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.OnRender(System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext)
member.summary: Called to render the visual - we place a transparent (hit-testable) rectangle on top of the text box.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.OnMouseLeftButtonDown(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Left button down

member.summary: Mouse movement

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.OnMouseLeftButtonUp(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Left button up

member.summary: Mouse wheel changes

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.OnMouseDown(System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: Detection for double-click support

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.Dispose
member.summary: This is used to remove the adorner

member.summary: This is used to change the focus to the text box and adjust the cursor

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.NumericTextBoxBehavior.CursorAdorner.AdjustValue(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is used to adjust the numeric value in the TextBox.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior
member.summary: This behavior tracks two ScrollViewer based controls and keeps their Horizontal and Vertical positions synchronized.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the behavior is attached to an AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: Override this to hook up functionality to the AssociatedObject.

member.summary: Called when the behavior is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.
member.remarks: Override this to unhook functionality from the AssociatedObject.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.HorizontalAdjustmentProperty
member.summary: This dependency property holds the horizontal adjustment factor when two ScrollViewer instances do not have the same size or elements.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.VerticalAdjustmentProperty
member.summary: This dependency property holds the vertical adjustment factor when two ScrollViewer instances do not have the same size or elements.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.TargetProperty
member.summary: This holds the target to synchronize to.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.OnTargetChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when the target property is changed.

member.summary: This handles the synchronization when the source list is scrolled.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.OnTargetScroll(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.ScrollChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This handles the synchronization when the target list is scrolled.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.AdjustScrollPosition(System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer,System.Windows.Controls.ScrollChangedEventArgs,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This is the command scroll adjustment code which synchronizes two ScrollViewer instances.

member.summary: The horizontal adjustment to apply between source and target.

member.summary: The vertical adjustment to apply between source and target.

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.SynchronizedScrollingBehavior.Target
member.summary: The target ScrollViewer to synchronize to

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, participates in rendering operations that are directed by the layout system. The rendering instructions for this element are not used directly when this method is invoked, and are instead preserved for later asynchronous use by layout and drawing.
member.param: The drawing instructions for a specific element. This context is provided to the layout system.

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Actions.SetFocusAction.Target
member.summary: This property allows you to set the focus target independant of where this action is applied - so you can apply the trigger/action to the Window and then push focus to a child element as an example.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ApplyEffect
member.summary: This action applies a specific media effect to the element. It is used as a Blend Action and will apply/remove an effect based on the Effect property (leave it null to clear any effect on the target element).

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ApplyEffect.EffectProperty
member.summary: Effect property

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ApplyEffect.Invoke(System.Object)
member.summary: Called to apply the effect when the trigger is active.
member.param: Can pass in specific effect if desired, overrides Property

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Actions.ApplyEffect.Effect
member.summary: The effect to apply

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.CloseDialogBehavior
member.summary: This behavior allows the designer to close a dialog using a true/false DialogResult through a button. This is already supported if the IsCancel property is true, but the IsDefault does not auto-dismiss the dialog without some code behind. This aleviates that requirement for the very simple dialogs that are completely VM driven.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.CloseDialogBehavior.DialogResultProperty
member.summary: DialogResult dependency property

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.CloseDialogBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: Called after the behavior is attached to an AssociatedObject.
member.remarks: Override this to hook up functionality to the AssociatedObject.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.CloseDialogBehavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: Called when the behavior is being detached from its AssociatedObject, but before it has actually occurred.
member.remarks: Override this to unhook functionality from the AssociatedObject.

member.summary: This dismisses the associated window

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.CloseDialogBehavior.DialogResult
member.summary: Dismiss dialog result value - this is assigned to the window.DialogResult to close the window.

member.summary: Defines the method to be called when the command is invoked.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.BindingTrigger
member.summary: This triggers off a binding expression. It allows a designer to run a set of actions using a MVVM property as the trigger. As a side effect it also allows the Value to be data bound so you can compare two ViewModel properties for equality and then run a set of actions when the condition is matched.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.BindingTrigger.ValueProperty
member.summary: Value to test against

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.BindingTrigger.OnValueChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called when the DP backed by the binding changes

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.BindingTrigger.CheckValue
member.summary: This compares a changed value

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.BindingTrigger.Binding
member.summary: Binding declaration of the conditional

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.BindingTrigger.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the Value property.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior
member.summary: WPF attached behavior which attaches a regular expression to a TextBox.

member.name: F:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.MaskProperty
member.summary: This property serves a dual purpose. First, it allows the behavior to be used as a traditional attached property behavior - without use of the Blend tool. Second, it acts as a local property to store the expression.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.GetMask(System.Windows.Controls.TextBox)
member.summary: Returns whether MaskedTextBoxBehavior is enabled via attached property

member.summary: Adds MaskedTextBoxBehavior to TextBox

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.OnMaskChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: This associates a new MaskedTextBoxBehavior onto a TextBox using the applied mask.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.OnAttached
member.summary: This attaches the property handlers - PreviewKeyDown and Clipboard support.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.OnDetaching
member.summary: This removes all our handlers.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.OnTextInput(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionEventArgs)
member.summary: This is called to process text (character) input

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.OnClipboardPaste(System.Object,System.Windows.DataObjectPastingEventArgs)
member.summary: This method handles paste and drag/drop events onto the TextBox. It restricts the character set to numerics and ensures we have consistent behavior.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.OnKeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: This checks the PreviewKeyDown on the TextBox to check for the SPACE character which is not considered a TextInput element.

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.GetTextFuture(System.String)
member.summary: This returns the next text value if the pending event is processed.
member.param: Text to add to the TextBox

member.name: M:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.IsMatch(System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to test the string input.

member.name: P:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.MaskedTextBoxBehavior.Mask
member.summary: Mask to use for the regular expression.

member.name: T:JulMar.Windows.Interactivity.DeferredScrollBehavior
member.summary: This class provides deferred scrolling capability to a normal scrollbar - the same way a ScrollViewer can have deferred scrolling.

member.summary: The Value property represents the current position of the ScrollBar. Changes made to this value will be propogated to the thumb value.

member.summary: This method adjusts the thumb position to the currently tracked value position.

member.summary: This attaches the behavior to the ScrollBar.

member.summary: This detaches the behavior from the ScrollBar.

member.summary: This is called when ScrollBar changes the thumb position.

member.summary: The current position of the ScrollBar.
